episodes.title: SourBoatJavascript: Adding a fake terminal to the web page, because mice are for pansies!
episodes.description: We will be working on writing up a bash-like terminal for the site that you can use to navigate and explore the videos on the site. Written in Javascript.

episodes.title: SourBoatWebPages: Base page almost finished! Starting a new fun project
episodes.description: We have pretty much wrapped up our basic show website now. There are many more useful things we could add to this, of course, but instead, we are starting a new project that is just for shits and grins!

episodes.title: SourBoatWebPages: Better document structure, worse css + a source for real data
episodes.description: We finally decide on a document structure and start styling it. It is super ugly. We also put in an easy hack to store our show data for the page (like this description)!

episodes.title: SourBoatWebPages: UI Frameworks and Databases today
episodes.description: Today we attempt to talk about web ui frameworks and databases but get sidetracked by The Hobbit and Technical Difficulties (tm).

episodes.title: Sour Boat Life: In The Beginning
episodes.description: This is the first recorded episode of Dan and I messing around writing software and generally just mouthing off. In general, we'll be experimenting with new technologies and playing around with whatever interests us while we pretend to be professionals that know what we're talking about. First, we have to write a web page for this show though!
